I played the demo of this game back in the early days of VR and had been looking forward to it for a long time, but after it's release I never really got into it for some reason.  Probably the buggy gameplay, long load times, and issues with locomotion.  Since their recent overhaul update, I revisited it and wound up having a blast.  Sure, the throwing can be a little wonky, but I stuck with it and managed to be effective enough to complete a playthrough.  It wasn't until the final stage that I realized that there was a "mutator" that you could turn on to allow for free movement in addition to the translocator gun.  Plenty of options for comfort baked into that too.  I wound up going with "jog" speed and snap turning, which peeled off a solid layer of tedium from the gameplay.  Put in about 6 hours, only crashed once, and enjoyed most of the experience except the end game, which was a bit overwhelming until I figured out how best to proceed.   Seems there are some additional alternate challenges to take on in the arcade mode, and turning on some of the more cheat related mutators adds some extra fun to another run at the stages.  It was overall a fun experience with good replay value that left me quite satisfied in the end.

Update: Entitlement check has been fixed.
I must say many of the issues that have bothered me to a degree that made this game not enjoyable have been adressed in some way. The once borderline loading times are now more reasonable. Knives don't fall out of your hand when teleporting. At launch and many months after things were still messy. When I played for 45min just now, I only encountered a few non-critical issues/bugs. It is fully playable now.

However I am still not fully satisfied with the knife throwing mechanic. At least now it works for close range throws, that used to be an impossibility. But throwing them further than an arm length still feels inaccurate and random. The physics work better in other games ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

My biggest issues with this game is the "hidden" requirement for a generous play area. This is mentioned nowhere. I only have very little space and the game often forces me to move in my room to reach for things like vents. The portal gun can often only move me so close to the spot and real movement is required. I guess I'm smooth loco spoilt, but room movement is really tricky for me.

The menu translations feel like they are the result of google translate. I'd prefer solid english menu over my native language with weird wording.

In the end I must say performance has very much improved. I have not noticed any framedrops and got solid 90 during the entire session. The Performance patch actually delivers!
e: just noticed the long list of additional improvements... Aim assist... must... try.. OK you'll get an extra star!

The game is fun. The stealth works and everything seems polished besides a couple bugs here and there. Pre-update, I had many issues playing the game but since then those issues have been solved. It has a solid story and I can't wait to play Budget Cuts 2. 9/10 would recommend
Awefull, so Buggy my kids couldn’t get through a level . Do not buy, can I give a zero?

one_reviews_text: Of all the VR games that I've played, this is one of the best. I would recommend it as a no-brainer purchase to stealth game enthusiasts. The music (when there is music) is quality, the gameplay is exciting and fluid, and there are many ways to beat each level, which is always nice. Even replaying the game for a third time I still find new pathways or areas I never knew about. On a side note, this game has one of the best movement mechanics of any VR game. It doesn't induce any motion sickness at all for me, which is another plus.

They sometimes just disappear. But other than that. Just a couple other little things like little glitches. But for conclusion. I loved the game and everything even if it wasn't perfect. review_title: One step forward two steps back
one_reviews_text: For every bright point in the game there is a point of needless frustration. The games bigest offenders are bad level design and poor controls. Though the later may just be an oculus thing as videos of people using the vive seem to be having a much better time of it. For me at least, opening drawers, getting things out of drawers, and turning screws were a night mare to get the game to register. The levels are hard to navigate and keep your bearings in, the worst offender being the final level, which also slaps the worst bit of backtracking the game has to offer right in your face before you see credits. Which left me leaving the game with only negative feelings despite the fun I had up to that point. Perhpas the sequal will fix all these problems, but for now get this only on sale or not at all.

This is the best stealth game in vr i've played so far. I would consider buying it, it lasted a while and was worth the price. The only problem I had was the boss was broken, i had to complete it about 5 times cuz it kept breaking so I eventully just looked up the ending.

i bought this game and i loved it the mechanics are great and the robot deaths are too convincing,the graphics are out of this world amazing. but i had one problem *spoilers ahead btw* the last level in the game is just impossible half the level is in the dark and when the lights come on it looks completly different not to mention the robot that you are trying to distract can always see you so when you alert it you're done for, i find this mostly frustrating because you are trying to get something in the room the robot is first in but you need a scewdriver but i found that and i just cant seem to do it quick enough i dont understand why the developers didnt put in a automatic scewing mechanism it wouldve made this game so much simpler rather then sitting on my knees for 20 minutes trying to get 4 screws but i know they did that for immersion but they could add in a different setting for it. but otherwise great game buy it

Don't get me wrong, I wanted to get this game badly from my experience from the Early Demo, advirtising, and non-spoiler video reviews, but after beating this game, I felt annoyed at the game's direction and the core of the gameplay. I feel like a fool for not buying any other game on my Wish List than this.
The beginning of the game was catching my attention, and I really enjoyed the mechanics. But after a while, I started getting dizzy moving my head everywhere and ducking around, to the point where it feels worse than playing Robo Recall. Regardless if you have the Rift S or 3 Sensor Setup, don't ever play this game on 360-Degree Room Tracking as the horrifying invention called the CORD will kink up your headset's wires and make it feel heavy and unplayable without accidentally damaging or losing that feel of being immersed.
Going back to the mechanics, it started getting bland really easily. "Get X Keycard, open Y Door, Collect Z Item." This game made me feel like an idiot, because I didn't know what to do or where to go even when you ask help from your pointless buddy agent, Winta.  I wanted this game to make me feel stealthy and sleek taking down gaurds and avoiding that wretched boss (Spoilers, name rhymes with "Shmadam,") but I only felt like I was being carried by game guides and forums on other people stuck on the last 3 or 4 parts of the game. This game is also very stressful when you can't use your non-dominant hand to fire a teleporting gun. Can't shoot up to the ceiling openings in time? Too bad, we'll just have those guards or Shmadam kill your for a dozen of times until you admit that you're dumb and want a solution to beat this short game to only find out that you're clumsy at playing this intense game.
I wish there was a good enough replayablity in this game, but I don't think the Arcade mode or 3 Different Difficulties seem promising for me to give this game another chance.

In Conclusion: If you have spare money, buy this game.
its a bit akward to get used to the throwing weapons but when you do this game takes off. man was i happy with this game, so much fun and i cant wait for the next one coming out soon

I started this game optimistic that it would be as great as everyone I know says it is but as I come across this part of the story (spoilers) where you have to go to the "maptrap" and drop all of your items in the maptrap it told me i still had one item that wasnt allowed so I thought "oh its my transporter or something" so I left and walked around a bit to find a diffrent way in. suprise there is no other way there is even a note that says there is only one way so I granted the game a fair point and got back to the maptrap and it still said I had one item so out of pure rage i looked for solutions on the internet which was already ruining the experince enough that i had to disconnect to look for a soulution to this games bug which was really hard to find anyone talking about it and this got me even more upset so once I found something that resembled the problem they said to reload my last save so I did and suprise my last save was after the glitch happened, remember I walked around for another way in? yeah well that was my last save and there is no way I have found to go to other saves in my game and because of this experience I give it 1 star

First of all, let me just get this out of the way: I love stealth games. Budget cuts has provided the first good stelath experience in VR. The translocator (innovative new locomotion system) alone makes it worthwhile to play. Essentially, you need to escape robots that want to report you to "HR" at your workplace. You can sneak around, or go full psycho and murder everyone, or a combination. Combat is cool, but overhand throwing is basically unusable. Underhand is a much better option. ***EDIT: There was just a massive update that fixes nearly all of the major physics isuues. Overhand and underhand throwing now feel FANTASTIC and make the game even better.***
Stealthing is where the game shines, however. You'll be ducking, crawling, and telporting all over to avoid the gaze of the terrifying guard robots. The amount of tension when you never know when a robot can turn around and spot you is so exhilating in VR. 
Finally, the game world has SO much detail. The friendly and hostile robots all have lots of funny voice lines, and the office is littered with visual humour and objects that you can pick up and interact with. Plates have a frisbee mechanic that's so fun I'm actually doing a plate-only playthrough to kill guards.

You'll be getting at 4-6 hour story mode and really nothing else, but there's quite a bit of replay value. Is it worth it? Up to you.
this game is very fun and challenging you have to sneak through the entire game, but its worth the money YOU SHOULD GET IT

Fingers crossed for a sequal

I like the idea of switching hand attachments and for the most part that works well, but as usual, thowing anything in VR just fails misserably and you're often killed by a robot because the knife went flying in the wrong direction.  I'm not as impressed as I wanted to be and feel there is much better out there.

Cons
1. Throwing knives is pretty much impossible.
2. Poor optimization (i'm playing on a 1080gtx).
3. Level layout can be pretty confusing.

Pros
1. Interesting teleportation mechanic.
2. Levels are pretty open ended (which also leads them to be confusing).

This is a decent game. But you it doesn't really force you to stealth, you can cheat by killing the robots by just getting them to follow you into a room which makes them easier to kill. Less impactful than the original demo of two years back. Still, a fun run.

review_title: Amazing at First.  Then Goes Down Hill.
one_reviews_text: When you begin this game and learn how immersive it is.  You'll be amazed.  Then you die a few times and learn how horrible the save points are.  This definitely has the signs of early VR.  I recommend it on sale.

There were some issues with throwing at first but the most recent update seems to have fixed that completely!
I really enjoyed this stealth adventure!  Wonderful crafted story, the devs really put their heart into this one!  Can recommend to anyone new to VR!

review_title: If Portal and Thief had a child...
one_reviews_text:
TL;DR A fun sneak-around-and-kill-stuff game. Playing it in room-scale has already had me lying on my (real) floor and crouching under (virtual) desks. But design flaws detract from the overall experience.

At the time of this review it's lacking a bit of polish, e.g. long loading times with a plain black screen, some objects  make no sound when you drop them, a few graphical glitches here and there, screws that require dozens of turns of a screwdriver to undo, and a scary boss that can't kill you. But I expect these will be fixed sooner rather than later (especially now the devs seem to have fixed the poor throwing mechanic that plagued the Oculus Rift version).

What stops this being a 5/5 game for me is:

1. Killing robots with teleport & stab, or lure & stab, is too easy.  Killing them by throwing knives/scissors is too hard.  Throwing would make for a more suspenseful game but it's just too tempting to stab.

2. The level design gives you lots of different ways of achieving your goal. But it also means I found myself lost and going round and round in circles sometimes. And getting lost once all the bad bots have been killed results in long periods of tedium while you wander around trying to find out how to complete the level.

3. Most drawers and cupboards can be opened. 99.99% of the time they contain nothing useful. Sometimes, while trying to find a knife/screwdriver/keycard the game felt like a drawer-opening simulator.

4. Opinion varies on this, but I didn't like the final level. The pace/style of the game changes significantly from the earlier levels.

Overall, I felt like a lot of love went into this game but it falls short of its potential. I've got big hopes for Budget Cuts 2.

(PS Anyone who says this game is polished hasn't played it all the way through. It's very buggy).

review_title: One of the few teleports that gets it
one_reviews_text:
i hate teleport games, but man this game was a blast, sneaking around and teleporting behind robots just to stab them in the face, just feels so good.

The game is fairly short(i completed it in about 3 hours), but if you are like me you will want to do a bunch of playthroughs(no kills, all collectables, hardest difficulty, without getting seen...etc) this game reminds me of playing old Thief games back in the day(i know its very different, but the same type of feeling). 

The game has a really colorful atmosphere and feel to it, the whole game is upbeat and chipper, and has a very unique humor about things. Just overall a great VR game, worth getting for sure.

This is a teleport only game, but they explain why in the plot. Because of this, I didnt mind. I got 4.5 hours game play start to finish. some parts are fairly difficult and you have to think out side of the box, but its not too bad. 

I recomend this game. It was a good VR experience and had me hiding behind things, even made me jump at one point.

review_title: very fun but a select few problems
one_reviews_text: i have played the game for almost 6 hours, its great and really makes you think about your next plan of action. its almost like a vr hitman game, but the throwing mechanics arent the best, most of the time they go off to the side instead of where you want, and one level took me a whole hour to beat the first time because i couldnt figure out what do do after killing all of the gaurds. but problems aside its almost perfect and a must buy for if you like stealth games.

I've barely played the game, I haven't even gotten to the part where I can use a tool to kill the camera guards, however I have played this game for a total of 2 hours. That's how insanely difficult this game is. It's one guard, one office, and I've been stuck on it for an hour. All I have to do is grab the keycard and go through the door and I can't. It's buggy, throwing things doesn't work, the teleport system sucks and the game just gets so boring to the point where it's annoying. And all of this maybe I can endure, if it wasn't for the fact THE GAME IS 30.00$ There is no way this game should be 30$, wait for a sale that brings the price below 20$ for your own sake!

review_title: I waited HOW MANY years for this?
one_reviews_text:
Such an immersive, interesting world and story ABSOLUTELY RUINED by glitchy knife-throwing mechanics, screwdrivers that barely turn along with your hands, and the worst performance-to-visual-quality ratio I've ever seen. And this is after THREE post-launch patches.

I love the story, I love the world they've created...but when your only defense against the bad guys is a well-placed knife throw, and the knife just stops mid-air and falls at your feet as you get shot, it's really hard to not feel like you're just wasting your time. Maybe the title of the game refers to its development cycle? Because that old demo on the Vive ran so much better.

I would be much more likely to recommend the game if it didn't end on a cliffhangar followed by "to be continued". As-is, I'd suggest getting it during a sale.

review_title: My favorite VR game for the next 10+ yrs
one_reviews_text: I   h a v e   y o u   n o w
It was one of the best vr games I have ever played! And I cant wait until the finish the rest of the story.

It is one of very few legitimate VR games. It has a very clever and unique locomotion system, it has a fun art style, and feels very polished. "Polished" in the way that it was obviously made for VR and is not some PC game ported to the Oculus with wanky controls etc. Yes, the throwing mechanic needs some work, and there will always be bugs with VR, but how many games thus far can actually put you in a world, with a semi-interesting story and make you actually ponder how you should approach a target or objective. I really hope the devs continue to improve upon this game. Maybe add some new and flavorful environments?

yes there are loading screens that are just black but you have to wait for a while until it loads I had to wait 5 minutes for the first one so just be patient. also the game was too short and I know it says coming soon but it was so good that I want more

As soon as this game was released, I immiediatly bought it without hesitation. I was really excited, and had been axiously awaiting the release for ages. Having played through the majority of the game, I can say that it defiently didn't live up to my expectations, however.

On my first two boots ups, the game crashed my computer, although aside from that the game has been running smoothly. Hopefully with the latest patch the aforementioned bug will be fixed.

The gameplay is good - althought does get quite repetative. Aside from the introduction of the throwing knives later on, the gameplay remains mostly the same, only increasing in difficulty as the game progresses. During my playthough, there were a few sticking points where I had to look up walkthoughs onliine - which I found to detract from the experience. For example, at the point in the game where you need to find the level 5 keycard, the only way to proceed is to find and teleport through a tiny vent hidden behind a ladder. 

The game also lacks overall polish. The loading screen consists of a pitch black "Have I crashed?" screen, and the world feels quite empty and lacking (pens you can't interact with, hundreds of completely empty draws and cupboards). It would be nice to incorperate some more Job Simulator-esqe gameplay elements to give the game a reason to replay or to search and look for exciting objects or easter eggs.

Overall, I would definetly recommend giving this game a try. I definetly enjoyed it, although it certainly doesn't live up to the high expectations and hype set up by the demo and community.  It also doesn't reach anywhere near the advertised "8 hour" gameplay, with even what I would consider a slow playthough only lasting about 4-5 hours.

This game is awesome.  You lose yourself in the game and end up tangling the lead around yourself due to all the sneaky crawling around the rooms.

Pity there is no multiplayer aspect to the game as sneaking around trying to kill another human player would be great.

I've found a few graphical glitches so far, where signs on the wall disappear, and re-appear. But other than that, this is a very fun game! Brilliant teleport mechanic, and use of room scale. Very immersive! It gets really intense hiding from the robots. I highly recommend this one!

Great immersion, fun environments, provides multiple ways to handle obstacles (has replayability), runs great on GTX1080 & GTX970, teleporting mechanic is one of the best I've seen. The way the teleportation keeps you in the center of your space should be a standard for all vr-games.

I do wish it were longer and that there'd be more varying environments, enemies and weapons.

Still, a must have game.
Really good production value, but it gets repetitive after an hour and a half. Level design is extremely linear, and is more often than not just a bunch of offices. This game is 75% offices.

It's alright. Buggy. Weird difficulty curve.

Some of the puzzles are unintuitive, or can unintentionally be skipped / altered by the player. IE open a desk to soon, accidentally throw away something valuable, etc. There are utilities in-game to help lessen this like the magnifying glass, but some things can still trap you.
review_feedback: If you accidentally misplace an important object in the game, you will soon after be able to find it in a Lost & Found. It *is* a different game, and it's meant to be. That said, of course it can't be for everyone. I hope you can get a refund if you're not happy with it!

one_reviews_text: Had a lot of fun playing this game. Check out my spoiler free gameplay review here: https://youtu.be/Zih4vJ2jfh8

So the game was good up until the bugs started happening, but those were fixed within a day. I beat the game in about 7 hours, and found a few bugs. Story was okay but the gameplay was the main highlight. Knife throwing could have been better, but the teleportation was great. The ending was really disapointing, and I wish that theres more content coming in the near future. Overall, I would buy it if it were 20 or 15 bucks, not 30.

The vr experience was great, I was really immersed in the world. There were texture glitches during the last half of the game, kinda ruined the immersion but I think they will patch it. I was just let down with the ending and cliff hanger. I wish the game continued the story feels half finished. I understand it will be continued in a sequal but I feel like it should of just finished in this game. I was able to beat it in 4 hours, thats with no help with the puzzles.

I got to play about 15 minutes of this game. After the first death the game crashed back to Oculus home. Subsequently the game would crash on start up.

GTX 1080 and I7 CPU

I'll change the rating once this bug is fixed
review_feedback: Aw, no! A quick fix is often updating the drivers for your graphics card. If your issues should persist, please drop us an email at support@neatcorporation.com and someone will help you ASAP.

one_reviews_text:
already updated drivers however no luck...can hear music while in headset says please wait...then Sorry budget cuts is taking a while to load...

Already uninstalled and reinstalled with no change?
review_feedback: If you would like to share your rig specs with us, please send them to support@neatcorporation.com and we can help you personally. Thank you for sharing! :)

one_reviews_text: Contain one of the most immersive and memorable VR experience i ever get throught. I recommend it, even if it took me only 4 hours to finish !
Price of admission is worth it for the immersion factor alone. Typically I don't play teleport mov't based games that cater to #VrComfort - but this is the exception.
I spent 30 bucks on the game and it never loads, I attempt to refund the second day and it say I can not refund. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME
Really fun VR experience.  A few bugs but nothing terrible.

review_title: Will Not Load. Do not purchase yet.
one_reviews_text: I have played the demo of this game on Steam and it *is* an excellent game. However, I cannot play the full game as it gets stuck loading the application. Once this is fixed I will change my review.
review_feedback: Thank you for the kind words! We're really sorry to hear that you are having issues. :C Any chance we can help you out? Drop us an email at support@neatcorporation.com and someone will get back to you asap.

one_reviews_text: The teleportation mechanism is terrible. You have to change your tool in hand, then use the joystick, then hold the grab button. It has potential but is so buggy that I find it unusable.
